g-2: ^Ben:: Come on, Luz. We just closed a huge case. Can't you relax for a second?
g-4: ^Ben:: You look like you haven't slept in days.
g-6: ^Ben:: You can't cheat sleep. Did you know we need 7 to 9 hours a night at our age?
g-8: ^Luz:: Hold that thought... getting a text.
g-9: ^Phone:: MVA @ Imperial and Vista Del Mar. Mutliple injuries.
g-10: ^Ben:: I don't get it. How come your phone's always faster?
g-12: ^Ben:: Not again! We've been working overtime all week.
g-13: ^Luz:: You're a detective now, Romero. That's the job. Come on, let's go see what we're dealing with.

CoffeeShopNightBen2: ^Ben:: Really should be getting to that accident. Don't want the watch captain to think we're napping.
CrashSceneOfficer1: ^Officer:: Wow! You guys got here fast!

g-1: ^Ben:: No rest for the weary on the AM watch.
g-2: ^Officer:: You're the new junior detective, right?
g-4: ^Ben:: Pleased to meet you, Officer Robinson.
g-5: ^Officer:: Call me Roy. You're lucky you're paired up with Detect Montoya. She's the best!

g-2: ^Officer:: Both driveres are in rough shape. No witnesses and no passengers. The paramedics just left for the hospital.
g-3: ^Luz:: Do you know when the crash occurred?
g-5: ^Officer:: Both cars had event data recorders, but it'll take a while to get the data back.
g-7: ^Officer:: I've got somebody working on the footage. It might--
g-8: ^Luz:: --Take a while. I know. I know. Anything else?
g-9: ^Officer:: Um, yeah. Turns out one of our victims is a celebrity.
g-10: ^Luz:: Can you send me a profile of each driver?
g-11: ^Officer:: I'm sending it to you now, detective.

CrashSceneOfficer3: ^Luz:: Hmmmm. Drunk driving conviction from a few years back.

g-1: ^Officer:: Mhm. Blood alcohol content 0.2 -- That's twice the legal limit.
g-2: ^Luz:: Can you send me a profile of each driver?
g-3: ^Officer:: I'm sending it to you now, detective.

g-1: ^Luz:: It doesn't matter what I think. What matters is the evidence.

CrashSceneOfficer5: ^Ben:: Holy cucamonga... Bryon Stark? THE Bryon Stark?

g-1: ^Luz:: That name sounds sort of familiar.
g-2: ^Ben:: Sort of familiar? He's a legend! Haven't you seen West of Eden? Colossal?
g-3: ^Luz:: I don't watch movies. Too busy.
g-5: ^Luz:: Focus, Romero. We need to handle this quickly and quietly.
g-6: ^Luz:: Forget about movies. I'll inspect the cars. You track down the families.

CrashSceneOfficer6: ^Officer:: I think you still need to find some more clues
HospitalSceneDoctorRoss1: ^Luz:: Dr. Ross, I'm Detective Montoya with the LAPD. Can I ask you a few questions?

g-3: ^DoctorRoss:: Mr. Stark's heart stopped shortly after he arrived. We worked to resuscitate him for over an hour, but were unsuccesful.
g-4: ^DoctorRoss:: Sadly, his injuries were too severe: He had fractures of multiple bones and ribs, a chest injury...
g-5: ^DoctorRoss:: ...a punctured lung, and was hemorrhaging from internal injuries.
g-6: ^DoctorRoss:: It is upsetting and so unfortunate that we could not save him.
g-8: ^DoctorRoss:: I pronounced him dead at 4:25 A.M.
g-10: ^DoctorRoss:: Turnipseed is in surgery. His injuries are critical, but not life-threatening.
g-11: ^Luz:: I need you to test for alcohol and other drugs. Anything that could've impaired his ability to drive.
g-12: ^Luz:: Please notify me as soon as he wakes up.
g-13: ^DoctorRoss:: Certainly. The medical investigator is on the left.

g-1: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Yep. I'm Emily Nguyen. Just examined the body and took samples for toxicology.
g-2: ^Luz:: Great, so we'll know if Stark was under the influence of any drugs.
g-3: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Poor guy. I've seen all his movies.
g-4: ^Luz:: Did you notice anything unusual about the body?
g-5: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Actually, yes. Stark has antemortem bruises on his shins, knees, and arms.
g-7: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Before death. That means the bruises weren't caused by the crash.
g-8: ^MedicalInvestigator:: They're from days or even weeks ago.
g-9: ^Luz:: Where are they taking the body?
g-11: ^MedicalInvestigator:: It's a circus out there. Reporters, fans... I heard they might have to airlift him.
g-12: ^Luz:: This is getting out of hand.
g-13: ^MedicalInvestigator:: The coroner might be a good place to get some more information.
g-14: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Better go quick before the public gets there!

g-1: ^MedicalInvestigator:: Never a dull moment here. Always more work to be done.
^Coroner:: Is it? You look like you've been up all night.
g-2: ^Luz:: So I have. What can you tell me about our victim?
g-3: ^Coroner:: Here's the preliminary report. Take a look.

g-1: ^Coroner:: His chest slammed into the airbag.
g-3: ^Coroner:: The impact bruised the muscle of his heart.
g-4: ^Coroner:: When his ribcage stopped on the airbag, his heart kept moving forward...
g-5: ^Coroner:: ...until it collided with the ribs and sternum.
g-6: ^Luz:: So his heart hit the INSIDE of his ribs? And that's how it got injured?
g-10: ^Luz:: So you think that the impact injured his heart, which eventually caused his heart to stop beating.
g-11: ^Coroner:: Right. Airbags are designed to reduce injury.
g-12: ^Coroner:: But they are much less effective when the occupant isn't wearing a seat belt.
g-13: ^Luz:: So you think that the impact injured his heart, which eventually caused his heart to stop beating.
g-14: ^Coroner:: Right. Airbags are designed to reduce injury.
g-15: ^Luz:: You mean Bryon Stark wasn't wearing his seat belt?
g-16: ^Coroner:: I don't know for sure, but seat belts typically leave marks on the body across the chest and waist.
g-18: ^Coroner:: Mr. Stark's injuries are consistent with a head-on collision; the injuries were severe.
g-19: ^Coroner:: A seat belt may have saved him.
g-20: ^Luz:: I'll see if Detective Romero found out about that seat belt.
g-21: ^Luz:: What about the toxicology? Any preliminary results?
g-22: ^Coroner:: Not yet. The toxicologist is working on the samples now. I'll let you know when the report is ready.
g-23: ^Luz:: Thanks, Dr. S. You're a lifesaver.
g-25: ^Coroner:: Although "lifesaver" isn't usually what you call a coroner.
g-26: ^Coroner:: Just make sure you don't end up on my table next. You look exhausted.
g-27: ^Luz:: Don't worry. Can't die anytime soon. Too busy.
g-28: ^Coroner:: You look like you're in a hurry too. I'm worried about you.
g-29: ^Coroner:: You look like you are not getting enough sleep.
g-30: ^Coroner:: Do you know what organ systems you are placing at risk by not getting enough sleep?
g-33: ^Coroner:: Lack of sleep increases your risk of high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity, heart disease, and stroke.
g-34: ^Luz:: That's something I could do without!
g-35: ^Coroner:: We all could. Except for poor Mr. Stark.
g-36: ^Luz:: Why do you think he crashed?
g-38: ^Luz:: Well sleep is nice and all that. But right now, I can't afford it.
g-39: ^Coroner:: Don't fool yourself. You are running these risks right now.
g-40: ^Coroner:: Besides, you will get short term benefits too: in ways that will help you on this case.
g-42: ^Coroner:: Well, sleeping more helps long-term memory, improves motor control...
g-43: ^Coroner:: ...provides time for the body to grow and heal, and helps build a stronger immune system.
g-45: ^Luz:: Wait: you said motor control. As in driving a car?
g-46: ^Coroner:: Well, not only that. Also walking, running--really any body movement.

g-1: ^Ben:: I talked to Turnipseed's family. Sounds like Eric Turnipseed was at a bar with his brother right before the crash.
g-2: ^Luz:: Well, that's not suspicious at all.
g-3: ^Ben:: Really? It sounded pretty suspicious to me...
g-4: ^Luz:: *Sigh* Didn't they have irony on the day shift?
g-5: ^Ben:: Come on. Let's go talk to Mr. Turnipseed.

TurnipseedPatientRoomSceneBen1: ^Ben:: We're here to interview Mr. Turnipseed.
TurnipseedPatientRoomSceneTurnipseed1: ^Luz:: Eric Turnipseed, I'm here to ask you a few questions abut the accident.

g-1: ^Turnipseed:: Who the heck are you two?
g-2: ^Luz:: I'm detective Maria Montoya. This is my partner, Detective Ben Romero.
g-5: ^Turnipseed:: Knew I'd get blamed. That's how it is in Hollywood. Just a bunch of fakes and phonies.
g-7: ^Luz:: What can you tell me about the accident?
g-8: ^Turnipseed:: Look, lady. All I remember is I was drivin' along mindin' my own business, and suddenly I wound up here.
g-9: ^Luz:: You have no memory of the crash?
g-10: ^Turnipseed:: Nothin'. I'm sure it was that phony Bryon Stark's fault. I tell ya, I'm fixin' to give him a piece of my mind--
g-13: ^Luz:: Were you drinking before the crash?
g-14: ^Turnipseed:: Not a drop. I'm a family man now.
g-16: ^Turnipseed:: Nope. I was taking Valium for tremors and muscle spasms, but I haven't needed it lately. Not since I got sober.
g-17: ^Luz:: One more thing. Where were you in the hours before the accident?
g-18: ^Turnipseed:: I'm a plumber. I was out on an emergency call. Worked 'till 2 A.M., then headed straight home.
g-21: ^Luz:: Mr. Turnipseed, we know you were at the bar last night.
g-23: ^Turnipseed:: Okay, well maybe I was at the bar, but I wasn't drinkin'!
g-24: ^Turnipseed:: Well, I don't think I was...
g-26: ^Phone: DA: I need an update on this case- stat

TurnipseedPatientRoomSceneBen2: ^Luz:: Come on, Romero. The district attorney needs to talk to us.

g-1: ^Ben:: Are you serious, Luz? I haven't slept in 20 hours!
g-3: ^Ben:: Not for me. I need a break.
g-4: ^Luz:: Fine. I'll talk to the DA. You can catch up once you've gotten your beauty sleep.

TurnipseedPatientRoomSceneTurnipseed2: ^Ben:: Eric, you've got to have more to your story
DAOfficeSceneDA1: ^DA:: The media frenzy around this case is growing faster than a wildfire.

g-1: ^DA:: PLEASE tell me you have something.
g-2: ^Luz:: We have a suspect: Eric Turnipseed, the driver of the pickup truck.
g-3: ^DA:: Does he have a criminal record?

DayCoffeeShopSceneBen1: ^Ben:: Ugh. MORE coffee?! You've got a stomach of steel.

g-2: ^Ben:: Yeah. I slept for a full four hours, and it was glorious.
g-3: ^Luz:: I meant updates on the case.
g-4: ^Ben:: Oh. Yep, I just got the cell phone records!
g-5: ^Luz:: Great. Let's see if they were using their phones around 3 A.M.

DayCoffeeShopSceneBenQuiz1Answer: ^Looks like it was well before the crash.
DayCoffeeShopSceneBenQuiz2Answer: ^Looks like it was well before the crash.
DayCoffeeShopSceneBen3: ^Luz:: Okay. Let's head out to the movie set. The DA wants us to rule out Bryon Stark as a suspect.

g-3: ^Ben:: You should really give this sleep thing a try.
g-4: ^Luz:: I would, but who needs sleep when you have coffee?
g-5: ^Ben:: Sleep helps your long-term memory. It helps you process the day's events.
g-6: ^Luz:: My memory's fine! And I'm a detective! I process events all the time.
g-7: ^Ben:: It's also where you process emotions. And it reduces depression and anxiety.
g-8: ^Luz:: Are you saying I'm MOODY? I don't have time for that. And we're wasting time, Romero. Let's get going.

DayCoffeeShopSceneBen4: ^Ben:: O.K., let's go to the movie set.

g-1: ^Luz:: Are you Edwin Porter, the director?
g-3: ^Luz:: I'm Detective Montoya. This is Detective Romero. We're looking into the death of Bryon Stark.
g-4: ^DirectorEdwin:: Oh, yes. Poor kid. He was driving to visit his family at the time of the crash.
g-6: ^DirectorEdwin:: Hard worker. Good kid. We hit some setbacks during filming. Everyone was working long hours, but Stark handled it like a pro.
g-8: ^DirectorEdwin:: Well, he was drinking Red Bull like water. But all of us were. That's the job.
g-9: ^DirectorEdwin:: He was taking sleeping pills too. I heard Stark complaining that he'd just run out of pills and didn't have to get a refill.
g-11: ^DirectorEdwin:: You mean, did someone know where he was going at 3 A.M. and wait in the shadows to ram him with a pickup truck?
g-12: ^DirectorEdwin:: Sounds pretty contrived to me. C+ script at best.
g-13: ^Luz:: Was Stark acting unusual in the past few weeks?
g-14: ^DirectorEdwin:: Well... He kept tripping over everything. Even gave himself a few bruises. But that's about it.
g-15: ^DirectorEdwin:: Listen, I'm busy here. Didn't you already catch the guy that killed him?

MovieSetSceneBen1: ^Ben:: Oh, you've got to be kidding me...

g-1: ^Luz:: Sorry, we can't comment on an ongoing investigation.

MovieSetSceneDirectorEdwin2: ^DirectorEdwin:: I better get back to work, detectives. But feel free to take a look around.
MovieSetSceneBen2: ^Luz:: Now we know where Stark's bruises came from. Sounds like he was pretty clumsy.

g-1: ^Ben:: That doesn't make sense. Stark was famous for his choreography.

CoronerSceneCoroner2: ^Coroner:: Hello, Luz... And you must be Luz's partner.

g-1: ^Coroner:: Welcome back to the autopsy room. The toxicology reports are in!
g-2: ^Luz:: Thanks. Let's see what we've got.
g-5: ^Coroner:: It's a prescription drug, usually sold under the brand name Xanax.

CoronerSceneStarkAnswer1: ^He was taking alprazolam, but not within the past few days.
CoronerSceneCoroner3: ^Coroner:: It has a sedatitve, calming effect.

g-1: ^Coroner:: It is often prescribed for anxiety and insomnia.
g-2: ^Luz:: But the report says he hadn't taken it in several days.
g-6: ^Coroner:: It's better known by its brand name, Valium.

CoronerSceneStarkAnswer2: ^He was taking diazepam, but not within the past few days.
CoronerSceneCoronerQuestion2: ^Coroner:: It can treat muscle spasms and...

g-1: ^Luz:: ...tremors for alcoholics, too, right? We found it in Eric Turnipseed's car, and he mentioned he was taking it.
g-3: ^Coroner:: Great forensics work: sleuting and science hand-in-hand.
g-5: ^Coroner:: ...the report shows that he hasn't taken it in DAYS, so it couldn't have affected his driving.

CoronerSceneBen1: ^Ben:: Maybe he really IS recovering from his alcoholism. But he was at the bar last night...

g-3: ^Luz:: Turnipseed was lying about the bar. He was conficted of DUI. This can't be!
g-4: ^Ben:: Slow down, Luz. What happened to, "It's the evidence that matters"?
g-5: ^Luz:: You don't understand. It HAD to be Turnipseed.
g-6: ^Luz:: Stark was just trying to get home, see his family. He didn't do anything wrong!
g-7: ^Ben:: Luz... Maybe you should sit down.

CoronerSceneCoroner4: ^Coroner:: You're agitated, Detective. You're not thinking clearly.

g-1: ^Luz:: Would you both just leave me alone? I'm fine!
g-2: ^Luz:: Look, Romero, I'm heading to the station to see if the traffic cam footage is ready. You can meet me there, if you're not too busy.

CoronerSceneCoroner5: ^Coroner:: It's O.K. Luz, just take a deep breath.
DayCrashSceneLuz1: ^Luz:: I better get to the police station...
PoliceStationSceneBen1: ^Ben:: There you are! What took so long? You usually beat me everywhere.

g-1: ^Luz:: I... uh... had a fender bender.
g-3: ^Luz:: I'm fine. So tell me, do we have info from the cars' data recorders?
g-4: ^Ben:: Officer Robinson says he has something for us.

PoliceStationSceneOfficer1: ^Officer:: Detectives, here is the data you requested for Bryon Stark's case.

g-2: ^Ben:: You wouldn't believe the pressure we've been under to close this case.
g-4: ^Officer:: I've been around here longer than you think, Detective Romero.

PoliceStationSceneOfficer2: ^Luz:: Wow. Stark was going twenty over the posted limit. He didn't even try to brake.

g-2: ^Luz:: Looks like Turnipseed was paying attention. He braked and turned the wheel right before the crash.
g-4: ^Officer:: It's here on the computer. Just came in.
g-5: ^Officer:: I can't believe this. It's like Stark didn't see the pickup at all!

PoliceStationSceneOfficer3: ^Ben:: Was Stark seeing ANYTHING at the time of the crash? It's like he was blind!

g-2: ^Luz:: I think I know what happened. We need to go talk to the DA.

PoliceStationSceneOfficer4: ^Ben:: Go Luz! I believe in you.
DAOfficeSceneDA2: ^DA:: Finally. PLEASE tell me you've got enough evidence to arrest Turnipseed.

g-2: ^DA:: Uh oh. I'm about to have a media frenzy on my hands, aren't I?
g-4: ^DA:: You said he was coming from the bar. And that he lied about it. What gives?
g-6: ^Luz:: No. There was no alcohol in Turnipseed's system. No Valium, either.
g-7: ^DA:: Even if he was sober, he still could be at fault. Do you have any proof that the other driver caused the crash?
g-8: ^DA:: Can you see who hit who in the traffic camera?
g-9: ^Luz:: The traffic camera footage shows that Turnipseed has a green light. Stark ran a red light and plowed right into him.
g-10: ^DA:: How did this happen? Was Stark texting?
g-11: ^Luz:: No. Stark wasn't using his phone at the time of the accident.
^DA:: So why did Stark run the red light?!
g-13: ^Luz:: Stark was sleep-deprived. I think he fell asleep at the wheel.
^DA:: What makes you suspect he was sleep deprived?
g-15: ^DA:: Did the director mention anything specific?
g-16: ^Luz:: The director said Stark was using energy drinks to stay awake and taking Xanax at night to sleep.
g-17: ^Luz:: Checking the prescription, it turns out that Stark ran out of pills a few days ago and didn't have time to get a refill.
g-18: ^DA:: That's all just preamble to the main event. Do you have evidence he was taking xanax? Did it impair his driving?
g-19: ^DA:: We need real evidence. Did the coroner tell you anything?
g-20: ^Luz:: Yes. Toxicology shows that Stark was taking Xanax recently, but not in the past few days.
g-21: ^DA:: That is consistent with being sleep deprived. But do you have evidence that Stark fell asleep at the wheel?
g-22: ^DA:: We need to know what Stark did. The car should have that data.
g-23: ^Luz:: The EDR report shows that Stark didn't try to brake or swerve. He drove straight into Turnipseed's pickup.
g-24: ^DA:: Okay. We know he wasn't texting, but he was sleep-deprived from long work hours and had run out of sleeping pills. That sure sounds like someone who dozed off at the wheel.
g-25: ^DA:: You better go talk to Eric Turnipseed. Let him know he's off the hook.
g-28: ^DA:: Now go wrap this up with Turnipseed.

DAOfficeSceneDA3: ^DA:: Keep gathering evidence. The more evidence, the more open and shut this case will be.

g-1: ^Luz:: I'm so tired. I could fall asleep right here.

TurnipseedPatientRoomSceneTurnipseed3: ^Luz:: How are you feeling, Mr. Turnipseed?

g-1: ^Turnipseed:: Like I was hit by a freight train.
g-2: ^Luz:: I just spoke to the Deputy DA. Bryon Stark was at fault. You're no longer a suspect.
g-3: ^Turnipseed:: Ha! I told you! Shoulda just listened to me, huh?
g-4: ^Luz:: Why did you lie about being at the bar?
g-5: ^Turnipseed:: Look, Bryon Stark is a hotshot actor. Everybody loves him. I'm just some guy with a drunk driving record. I know how these things go.
g-6: ^Luz:: The truth is out now. Everyone will know you're innocent.
g-7: ^Turnipseed:: Ha. For detectives, you're pretty slow.
g-8: ^Turnipseed:: Thanks for clearing my name, and all. You convinced the cops. That's somethin'.
g-9: ^Turnipseed:: But how am I going to convince everyone else?
g-10: ^Luz:: You can deal with all this stuff in the morning. For now, try to get some sleep.
g-11: ^Turnipseed:: It ain't that simple! How am I supposed to sleep at a time like this?!
g-12: ^Luz:: Honestly? I'm still figuring that part out.

CutSceneBeforeCoffeeShopNight: ^<Montoya: Come on. Let's get some coffee. (CLICK to continue)>
CutSceneBeforeHospital: ^<Paramedic Rescue Abulance 5 pulls up outside the emergency department>

g-1: ^<Bryon Stark is wheeled out of the ambulance and into the ER.>
g-2: ^<The medical team works tirelessly to save his life, but the team is unsuccessful.>
g-4: ^<The hospital staff covers the body and wheels the gurney into a secure room.>

g-1: ^<A huge crowd of reporters and fans swarm outside the hospital.>
g-2: ^<Bryon Stark's body is transported to the coroner's office by helicopter.>

CutSceneBeforeHospitalScene2: ^<FLASHBACK: You're in the backseat of an old station wagon, looking forward.>

g-1: ^<FLASHBACK: Rain hits the windshield. The windshield wipers are working furiously.>

CutSceneBeforeCoronerScene2: ^<FLASHBACK: You're in the backseat of the station wagon, looking forward.>

g-1: ^<FLASHBACK: In the front seat, your mom is nodding off.>
g-2: ^<FLASHBACK: There is a stop sign ahead.>

CutSceneBeforeDayCrashScene: ^<You're driving down a residential street, present day. The road blurs in front of you.>

g-2: ^<FLASHBACK: In flashback, you see your mom's head slump over onto the wheel.>
g-3: ^<FLASHBACK: She runs the stop sign, just a s a vehicle pulls out ahead of you.>
g-5: ^<You have driven off the road, into someone's yard.>
g-6: ^<Water from a sprinkler hits your windshield.>
g-7: ^<Shaken, you unbuckle your seatbelt and step out to survey the damage.>

CutSceneEnding: ^<Montoya and Romero step outside the hospital. The parking lot is crowded with reporters and news vans.>

g-3: ^<ROMERO: You're going home now, right? You need some sleep.>
g-4: ^<Montoya: If I can. I'm not sure I remember how.>
g-7: ^<ROMERO: Why don't you let me drive?>
g-8: ^<Montoya: That might be a good idea.>
g-11: ^<ROMERO: Luz? Oh well, it can wait.>
g-12: ^<ROMERO: <To radio> "14 Henry 9, Pacific Division, West Bureau: Reporting End of Watch.">
